description: Using the evidence of archaeology, this course will survey religious practices in the ancient Mediterranean from the Greek Dark Ages to early Christianity. Organized chronologically and thematically, the course will consider issues like the function of animal sacrifice, the homes for the gods (temples, churches, etc), religion and the city, ruler cult, funerary rites, home-based rituals, and 'alternative' cults. We will pay particular attention to the methodological issues raised by the archaeology of religion and how our own modern assumptions about religion impact our study of the ancient world.
name: ARCHAEOL GREC-ROM RELIG
